metadata.title: CVE-2022-23634 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Puma is a Ruby/Rack web server built for parallelism. Prior to `puma`version `5.6.2`, `puma` may not always call `close` on the response body.Rails, prior to version `7.0.2.2`, depended on the response body beingclosed in order for its `CurrentAttributes` implementation to workcorrectly. The combination of these two behaviors (Puma not closing thebody + Rails' Executor implementation) causes information leakage. Thisproblem is fixed in Puma versions 5.6.2 and 4.3.11. This problem is fixedin Rails versions 7.02.2, 6.1.4.6, 6.0.4.6, and 5.2.6.2. Upgrading to apatched Rails _or_ Puma version fixes the vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

puma - 3.12.4-1ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: puma package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.12.4-1ubuntu2+esm1').
